Text: If I could give this app a negative review I would. I'm not a huge fan of my dot to begin with but the app just destroys any positive feelings I might have had. One of the biggest things I use the app for is text to speech on my Kindle books. Not only can I not arrange how I want the icons to look or hide services I don't use, but I can't search through my books for the title I want or sort them. It is also virtually impossible to just say "Alexa read XXXXX" because she has no idea what I'm talking about. My roommate foumd the same thing when she tried to get the app to read to her. You have to dig through all the books to find the one you want and then hit play. Also, Alexa is extremely spotty with pronunciation (i.e., a character whose name is Manny sometimes gets called Man, sometimes pronounced Many and sometimes pronounced Manny; a character named Colin is sometimes prounced like Cawlin and sometimes like Colon). All that being said, the biggest thing I hate about the app is that it randomly stops, as if a sleep timer went off and it stops reading. If I wake her up by saying "Alexa", she reads a few more words and then stops or she will randomly start reading again (i.e., a 3 am the book will come back on for a sentence or two and then will stop again). This would continue the whole book if I let it. Amazon says it's most likely the internet connection but I can tell you it absolutely is not. I realize Alexa was a pioneer in AI in her early days, but one would think Amazon would have improved her since then. Not so much.

Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: Not sure why so many bad reviews. Seems a lot of reviews are on the device itself and not the app. 2 totally different things. Once paired you really don't need the app. App works great and always has same with the echo itself. Never had 1 issue. It understands me 99.9% of the time the other .1% is because either the tv is too loud but not the device itself. Someone was talking carp about searching music. Just say a name of a song or artist and it will be played. I think most reviews are due to user error and not the device. Sure the app could use a little work but for the most part it works flawlessly. Easy to find skills and set alarms, add more devices and link my smart home devices. I don't know why people say it's hard to connect to WiFi because it is the easiest device I've ever hooked up to my wifi. Its never lost connection either. Only when the power has gone out but as soon as it's back on so is alexa. I have over 70 devices paired with the app and alexa has not once messed up when giving a command to lock a door or turn on a light. I would definitely recommend it over Google home any day.
